content:
Freshman infielder Jackson Nicklaus during the baseball game against Pacfifc on April  PERIOD

Oklahoma   Big  defeated Pacific   in the first of three nonconference games this weekend on Thursday in Norman PERIOD

Freshman infielder Jackson Nicklaus redshirt sophomore infielder Peyton Graham redshirt sophomore catcher Jimmy Crooks and freshman outfielder John Spikerman all produced two hits at the plate PERIOD They combined for five runs and two RBIs PERIOD

Redshirt freshman Cade Horton got his first collegiate start on the mound giving up a hit and two walks PERIOD The righthander struck out two in four innings in the win PERIOD

Sophomore Carson Atwood redshirt sophomore Chazz Martinez freshman Aaron Calhoun freshman Keegan Allen and redshirt junior Jaret Godman pitched the final five frames PERIOD The group combined for six strikeouts and allowed three runs on seven hits PERIOD

The Sooners broke the deadlock in the fourth inning with an RBI single through the right side by Crooks that scored Graham PERIOD Redshirt sophomore infielder Blake Robertson reached home on a wild pitch in the same frame PERIOD

In his first career start Spikerman reached home on a sacrifice fly ball by Graham in the fifth inning PERIOD Pacific catcher Jeremy Lea hit the only home run of the night off of Atwood in the fifth inning to cut the Sooners lead to  PERIOD

OU responded in the bottom of the frame with four runs of its own PERIOD Redshirt sophomore pinch runner Kendall Pettis scored on a sacrifice fly ball by freshman infielder Wallace Clark PERIOD Then Robertson ripped a threeRBI double down the left field line PERIOD

Lea knocked in two more runs in the ninth inning with a single up the middle PERIOD

Oklahoma continues its nonconference weekend slate against Lamar at  p.m PERIOD on April  in Norman PERIOD

title: OU baseball: Sooners defeat Pacific 7-3 to open nonconference weekend at home | Sports | oudaily.com
